Posts.Content: Got my results back today and I'm feeling pretty pleased. No spread to the lymph nodes but belt and braces chemo, radio and tamoxifen. Also HER2+ so herceptin but I'm just so relieved I'll take anything and everything! Xx
Posts.Title: Year today since diagnosis

Posts.Content: Said about 5/6 weeks after surgery which will be the last week in September. Meeting oncologist next Monday so should find out then. Xx
Posts.Title: Year today since diagnosis

Posts.Content: Good thinking Caitlin, I'll start buying my 'chemo kit'!  Why does dark nail varnish help? Are you going to try the cold cap? I've just asked my nurse and she said to give it a go. I'm meeting my oncologist for the first time next Monday then ecg s etc so probably start the week after.  Xx
Posts.Title: Year today since diagnosis

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynn, that's really helpful. I will make notes so I remember it all. I'm the same Caitlin, fine one minute then in a right state about it coming back the next. I seem to be worse late at night as well and am just trying to keep as busy as possible to distract myself. My work have offered me a counselling service through their insurance company so I'm going to phone them as I think that might help.  xxxx

Posts.Content: What an inspirational post! I had a mastectomy 2 and a half weeks ago and an waiting for my results (Monday). This has really cheered me up, thank you for posting xxx

Posts.Content: I'm good thanks, having to be careful I'm not overdoing it though as I feel so normal! Had a temporary expander reconstruction and my nurse did say he may pump it up for the first time on Monday, as if I wasn't stressing enough about going for my results!   Have you had or are you planning on having a reconstruction? Xx
